column5: When you look at the Wilcraft website you can find out that machine is good on thin ice, hunting on open water and even they use it as a rescue vehicle in the State. Also I know some people using as a fishing boat during summer time. I have been posting in this forum for getting a help to get insurance but in Ontario, seems no insurance company is interested to insurance this machine if they do, they charge more than $1000 per year,they giving you the excuse once you getting onto the water and it is not cover, or once you get onto the ice , and it is not cover. Some said once you get onto the land, it is not cover. They don't even care the Wilcraft use it as a recue vehicle in the State. If our members in that board works as an insurance agent, we may get some help from them!  Thanks in advance!
I would get hold of Slys' (RIP) lady, DlmATV on the other site, she would know.
It's no different than an argo when it comes right down to it.. is it? Floats and drives...should be insured/able the same.
I do believe Sly insured and Licensed it as a boat
